body: @lovedl I'm not sure. But you can modify the `Makefile`, don't delete `*.o` file after compile. If you recompile, the compiler only compile the modified file and relink.
Need to pass it down.
LGTM. Could you help to check why jenkins test failed? I cannot open the link. @piiswrong
@ysh329 Sorry to hear that...

This is our mistake.

You can use `device = mx.gpu()` for now. I will fix this soon.
I can't open either. Something is wrong with this PR. Maybe close and open another
Fixed in #6819

How to update the package on ubuntu ?

This is mergeable if it is fine to add R test into Jenkins servers. @piiswrong
Done.
build still fails, @piiswrong can you check the log to see if this is something I can fix?
I am afraid you need to "git pull" and "make rpkg" again.
Error is due to you changed submodule: https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/pull/6822/files

But I reverted this change, or so I thought.
And I think rebase from upstream made it in the first place..
Can you suggest how to fix?
Try checkout upstream master and cherry pick your changes.

@kimtang @lichen11 Maybe you can try the code below:

```r
library(mxnet)

data <- mx.symbol.Variable("data")
fc1 <- mx.symbol.FullyConnected(data, name="fc1", num_hidden=128)
act1 <- mx.symbol.Activation(fc1, name="relu1", act_type="relu")
fc2 <- mx.symbol.FullyConnected(act1, name="fc2", num_hidden=64)
act2 <- mx.symbol.Activation(fc2, name="relu2", act_type="relu")
fc3 <- mx.symbol.FullyConnected(act2, name="fc3", num_hidden=10)
softmax <- mx.symbol.SoftmaxOutput(fc3, name="sm")

library(DiagrammeRsvg)

res <- export_svg(graph.viz(softmax))
res <- charToRaw(res)
library(rsvg)
res <- rsvg(res, height = 5000)
library(png)
writePNG(res, "test.png")
```

Alright ................... Thank you so much.

@kimtang : Thank you, it does help.
Please try to use a smaller `hidden_node=50`.
@lovedl These functions will be released soon.
I think this can be fixed by #6673
Try to use module instead of model?
Data parallelism should get the same result on single device if batch size remains the same.

Here is alexnet model definition: https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/blob/master/example/image-classification/symbols/alexnet.py

You can train with https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/blob/master/example/image-classification/train_imagenet.py
Can you share your code or provide a minimal reproducible example?
@abuzn did you means your customOp's shape may be change every batch since it relates to the input data. Or you means the customOp's shape is relates to the attribute parameter like arange?
@Ldpe2G I mean  customOp's shape changed every batch since it relates to the input data. Is it possible in mxnet?

It was disabled because of a numerical stability issue.
But, in terms of performance, there is no big difference.

It will be re-activated in the future, with a new MKL-DNN library.
I have not got the search result, what do you mean search in module?
close and open another one
@Ldpe2G Thanks
move to #6828

@szha sorry for being late, I updated the mxnet package for anaconda to version 0.10.0.
https://anaconda.org/pjmtdw/mxnet
https://anaconda.org/pjmtdw/mxnet-cudnn

If you are speaking about anaconda package for Windows,
since I'm not so familiar with Windows, it is hard for me to create it.
submodules issue seem resolved.
@ykim362 when will it become available?

Is caffe converter tested? Maybe we should setup CI?

@mli Could you have a look?
@szha Currently, an integration with the new mkl-dnn library is under development together with the sparse tensor refactoring. So, it might be available in 3-4 weeks.
Thank you very much! One follow-up question: are we able to save the network structure as a horizontal figure? I tried res <- rsvg(t(res), width = 5000), but didn't work.

@Soonhwan-Kwon ， after the sorted epoch, the random epochs get no much improvement in my training as shown in the figure(4 epochs including the first for sortagrad epoch). Can you give me some advice, please?
![cer](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20516775/27572676-e5ed8ed8-5b3f-11e7-984f-f5fe52263050.png)

@ykim362 Do you have a stable version of mxnet on KNL or KNM machines? 
The version (0.9.2)  I am using now looks like there is a problem with the correctness in the backward calculation. I have modified the  way to  calculate FC to call sgemm, the result was error.

I try to initialize the network with constant parameters and use uniform input data.
And then compared with the calculation results of P40, the forward results are consistent, but the backward is not the same.

@BiranLi Which version of MKLML are you using? The previous MKLML has an error in backward pooling layer. Could you try to use this MKLML lib? You can download the file and copy include and lib directories into your MKL root directory. It is set to /usr/local by default. https://github.com/01org/mkl-dnn/releases/download/v0.7/mklml_lnx_2017.0.3.20170424.tgz

@ykim362 I am using a stable MKL2017 library which version is 20170127, not a MKLML library. 
What about the MKL library needs to be updated to lastest. I check the intel official website, the lastest library's version is 20170413.
@BiranLi I see. Is there any way you can try MKLML? In the case of MKL 2017, I will check with the team working on MKL 2017, tomorrow.

@ykim362  I'm tring to download the MKLML lib, but I cannot access the download page. Could you send me  a download package by email or cloud disk？
I see. Thank you for your assistant.
@BiranLi The above link is a public github location. Do you have an access to other github repositories?
@ykim362  I mean this package is hosted on the Amazon cloud, and my network here is not normal to visit the Amazon cloud.

@BiranLi The MKLML package is on github.com, not on Amazon cloud. On any machine you have an internet access, you can download it. Then, you can transfer the tgz file into your specific node.

https://github.com/01org/mkl-dnn/releases/download/v0.7/mklml_lnx_2017.0.3.20170424.tgz

@ykim362 All the download links redirect to amazonaws. Such as https://github-production-release-asset-2e65be.s3.amazonaws.com/58414589.It's error msg is 

> _github-production-release-asset-2e65be.s3.amazonaws.com connect timeout._
@BiranLi I think you might need to check your network. The link works fine on several different machines. It doesn't forward to AWS on my side.
@ykim362  My company's DNS maybe redirect the link. Thank you.
@BiranLi No problem! Thanks.
Thanks Nick.
@yash1 , the order of data_names your pass to Module should same with provider_data and provider_label in data iterator, I guess

@lovedl , you can just change the code and make, gcc will only re-compile the file you changed and those related with it

if some unexpected problem  appear, try `make clean`, and make to re-compile all frame work

besides, 
1. `make -j  $(nproc) YOU_OPTIONS` will compile parallelly
2. `gdb --args python YOU_ARGS` can debug with gdb
@piiswrong
try `nvidia-smi` to see the status of GPU, are there other program running on GPU and used most of memory?

@liuzhi136 you can refer to this project:
https://github.com/magic282/MXNMT/tree/next/mxwrap/attention
@liuzhi136 the sockeye seq2seq project (https://github.com/awslabs/sockeye) also contains a couple of attention models.
@piiswrong Looks good to me. Thanks @CNevd
@dtmoodie These settings also boost training speed!

Thank you.

LGTM. Any idea why the build fails?
The only error is due to test timeout, can someone check this, maybe update the timeout?

@BiranLi I have confirmed that the latest MKL(full MKL) you can download in the below link has the same fixes in MKLML0424. Its build date is 04/30.
https://software.intel.com/en-us/mkl
